isis.stitle: HENDRICKSON SUSPENSION SYSTEMS - INSTALL AXLE AND BEAMS

step1.para: Roll the axles with the beams attached under the vehicle.
Install both torque rods at the frame bracket ends, then at the axle bracket ends.
With the saddle caps removed, lower the chassis so that the saddles contact the beam center bushings.
With vehicle weight on the beam center bushings, install saddle caps, washers, and locknuts. Evenly tighten the locknuts.
Remove the wheels from the front or rear axle. This will give you access to tighten the saddle cap nuts properly. Refer to GROUP 17-RIMS, WHEELS AND TIRES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Tighten saddle cap nuts to specifications. Refer to the TORQUE CHART .
Install wheels. Refer to GROUP 17- RIMS, WHEELS AND TIRES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

Release all spring parking brakes on the tandem axles and connect the drive shaft to the front of the forward drive axle. Refer to GROUP 04-AIR BRAKES AND GROUP 06-PROPELLER SHAFT in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Connect all air lines leading to the rear axles and charge the vehicle air system. Remove the blocks from the front wheels.
Road test vehicle for proper operation before putting vehicle back into service.

note.para: When installing the rubber-bushed beams to the axles and saddles, do not tighten the nuts until the torque rods are installed and the equalizing beams are level with the frame. When these conditions are met, tighten all nuts to the values found in the TORQUE CHART, 13.0..
